intro: Tumion californicum, commonly known as the California tumion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
